programme.title: Danger Force
programme.desc: Miles Has Visions: When AWOL starts seeing visions of the future before they happen, Captain Man believes it must be the work of Swellview's leading time-crime villain, The Time Jerker. (S1, ep 20)

programme.title: Danger Force
programme.desc: Monsieur Man Returns: When Captain Man goes on strike because he refuses to pay for art that he destroyed on a mission, the Vice-Mayor hires a new hero to defend Swellview - Monsieur Man. (S1, ep 22)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Patch Me If You Can: Phoebe visits her boyfriend's shy brother, but the mild-mannered boy discovers his evil side when he gets his hands on one of Max's inventions. (S3, ep 10)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Give Me a Break-Up: Phoebe's relationship with her superhero boyfriend is put to the test when he is offered an assignment overseas. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Henry & the Woodpeckers: When Piper's basketball coach quits, Henry becomes the coach of Piper's team. (S2, ep 4)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Captain Man Goes on Vacation: Ray has trusted Henry and Charlotte with protecting Swellview while he's out of town at his cousin's wedding. (S2, ep 5)

programme.title: Hunter Street
programme.desc: Sleepwalkers: Anika and Florian head into the tunnels to follow Miss Lucas's coordinates. Jennie is determined to get at the supercomputer but discovers more than she's bargained for. (S4, ep 13)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: The Cat-fu Show: Meow-Paw, Milady's grandpa, comes to visit her in view of the traditional Cat-fu Day show. The Buffycats are all enthusiastic and Milady wants to give her best. (S2, ep 26)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: Whisker Twister: Tired of playing Yarn Hoops, the Buffycats decide to make a Cat Swap, exchanging for other games. But after exchanging various objects, they're back to square one. (S2, ep 27)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: Three Cats and a Kitten: Milady, Pilou and Meatball offer to babysit little Hope while her mum Lola leaves in search of her lost Whisker Twister - but looking after Hope is a real mission! (S2, ep 28)

programme.title: Best & Bester
programme.desc: Best and Bester turn into chess pieces in 'Chess-a-pult', then in 'Smart & Smarter', Bester and Best are tasked with neutralising enemy ransomware for the Bettervale Investigation Bureau. (S1, ep 14)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Plankton teams up with Man Ray to take over the Krusty Krab and the world in 'Super Evil Aquatic Villain Team Up Is Go!', and in 'Chum Fricassee', Squidward quits the Krusty Krab to work for Plankton!

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob and Patrick go on an advertising blitz in 'The Good Krabby Name', and in 'Move It or Lose It', Mr. Krabs and Plankton issue petitions to get their rival's restaurant bulldozed.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs Show: Gargamel plants a crystal ball to spy on the Smurfs, but they turn the tables on him with a fabricated drama. (S1, ep 19)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Vanity and Jokey start riding on 'Smurfboards', then in 'Monkey See, Monkey Do', The Magic Supply Store mixes up Papa Smurf's and Gargamel's orders, leaving Papa Smurf with a monkey! (S1, ep 20)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob & Patrick's Timeline Twist-up: When Patrick's Time Closet goes wrong, SpongeBob's history is re-written by time traveling interlopers. (S16, ep 14)

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: A Madness to Their Methods: Rebel Rouge and Renegade Knuckles walk the newly liberated streets of New Yoke City unsure of what's next, until the Mothership redocks atop the Yoke. (S1, ep 13)

programme.title: The Thundermans

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Licence to Fly: Ray agrees to let Henry fly his helicopter, but it's too much for Ray when he starts to act like a nervous parent. Charlotte, Jasper, and Piper find a cotton candy machine. (S3, ep 15)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Smurfette accidentally loses the Smurf Village in 'Wanna Bet?', then in 'Gargamel, Queen of the Prom', the Smurf Girls invite all the Smurfs to their Grand Equinox Ball. (S2, ep 24)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Leaf gets sick, causing some wild climate changes in 'Leaf's Under the Weather', then in 'House Call', Gargamel gets sick, and the Smurfs feel obliged to help him. (S2, ep 25)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob's new friend is a giant fluffy hamster who no one else can see in 'Cuddle E. Hugs', then in 'Pat the Horse', Patrick wants to be a horse!

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Gary has a pet translation collar and he's talking up a storm in 'Chatterbox Gary', and in 'Don't Feed the Clowns', a small clown gets left behind by the circus so SpongeBob takes them under his wing.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Leni is torn between her work and school friends in 'Everybody Loves Leni', then in 'Middle Men', Lincoln and Clyde go to tour the middle school, and Lynn gives them questionable advice. (S3, ep 19)

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Lincoln worries he's predictable and vows to change it up in 'Predict Ability', then in 'Driving Ambition', Lori finds that the golf coach from her dream college is coming to see her play. (S3, ep 22)

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: Pat The Hapless goes on a barbaric quest to the shopping mall in 'Chopping Spree', then in 'All Bot Myself', after Captain Quasar buys a new robot, Pat-Tron works for the Star family. (S3, ep 2)

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: A fitness variety show shows Patrick how to exercise in 'Star-Robics', then in 'Who's the Dummy Now?', a family of dummies move into the Star home. (S3, ep 3)

programme.title: The Thundermans

programme.desc: Budget Cuts: When the Vice Mayor cuts Captain Man and Kid Danger's budget to build a high speed railway in Swellview, Captain Man and Kid Danger must find creative ways to save money. (S4, ep 10)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Great Smurf Games: The winning team will receive a magical sphere that grants its owner one wish. Clumsy has got his heart set on taking part so that he can win this coveted prize. (S3, ep 6)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Gargamel clones himself to capture all one hundred Smurfs in 'His Own Worst Enemy', and in 'Tree of Knowledge', the Smurfs unwittingly ask Dimwitty for advice when he gets stuck in a tree. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: The Yard Sale: GrandPat prevents his precious memories from being sold at a family yard sale. (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: The Loud House

programme.title: The Thundermans

programme.title: Victorious

programme.title: Popularity Papers

programme.title: Henry Danger

programme.title: Danger Force

programme.title: Danger Force
programme.desc: Family Lies: It's Parents' Night and Ray must get Danger Force to take a picture with their parents in the school or be shut down. But Chapa hires Jake Hart to be her fake dad. (S1, ep 23)

programme.title: Henry Danger

programme.desc: Warren Seville: When Alvin tries to break Theodore's dependence on Talking Teddy, Theodore invents a new imaginary friend. (S5, ep 13b)

programme.desc: Squidward joins a crew of sailors hunting down the great white jellyfish. Plankton finds a magic bean that takes him to a land of giants (well, more giant than usual).

programme.title: Blero yn Mynd i Ocido

programme.title: Ne-wff-ion

programme.title: Odo
programme.desc: Mae angen i Odo neud i'r ieir chwerthin er mwyn iddo fe a Dwdl ymuno a'r Clwb Clwcian. Odo needs to make the chickens laugh so that he and Doodle can join their Club Chicken.

programme.title: Pentre Papur Pop
programme.desc: Ar yr antur popwych heddiw mae Twm yn darganfod chwilen arbennig sy'n gallu canu. On today's poptastic adventure, Twm finds a very special singing bug!

programme.title: Ein Byd Bach Ni
programme.desc: Heddiw ni'n teithio i wlad sy'n grefyddol ac yn gartref i fynydd talaf y byd, sef Nepal. Today we go to the top of Mount Everest with the help of the people who live there - the Sherpas.

programme.title: Joni Jet
programme.desc: Pan aiff Jet-fam i hedfan efo Jetboi, ceisia Joni wneud popeth y ffordd 'iawn', gan amau ei fod ar brawf. When Jet-mom goes to fly with Jet-boy, Joni tries to do it all the 'right' way.

programme.title: Byd Tad-cu
programme.desc: Heddiw, mae Sin yn gofyn 'O ble mae eira'n dod?' ac mae Tad-cu'n adrodd stori dwl a doniol am ddewin drygionus o'r enw Nef Niwl. Today, Sin asks Tad-cu 'Where does snow come from?'.

programme.title: Timpo
programme.desc: Beth sy'n digwydd ym myd Timpo heddiw? What's happening in the Timpo world today?

programme.title: Anifeiliaid Bach y Byd
programme.desc: Dewch ar antur gyda ni i gwrdd ag anifeiliaid bach y byd. Yn y rhaglen hon, yr hippo a'r camel sy'n cael y sylw. In this programme, we get to know the hippo and the camel.

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: Mae Ela wrth ei bodd yn chwarae 'tywysoges' ac rhywbeth mae twysogesau'n ei hoffi yw gair newydd heddiw. Will Princess Ela be able to find today's majestic word?

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: Pan mae Pablo eisiau chwarae phlant eraill yn y parc nid ydynt eisiau chwarae efo fo. Beth sy'n bod? Pablo wants to play with the children in the park, but they keep moving away. Why?

programme.title: Cymylaubychain
programme.desc: Mae'r Cymulaubychain a Seren Fach yn cael trafferth cysgu. Mae 'na swn rhyfedd yn eu cadw'n effro. Sut mae rhoi taw arno? The friends are having trouble sleeping because of a loud noise.

programme.title: Twm Twrch

programme.desc: Mae Blero'n gollwng ei frechdan jam, ac yn methu deall pam ei bod yn disgyn i lawr a ddim i fyny? Blero accidentally drops his jam sandwich, but why does it fall down and not up?

programme.title: The File of the Golden Goose
programme.desc: 1969. Thriller. Directed by Sam Wanamaker. Stars Yul Brynner, Charles Gray & Edward Woodward. A U.S. agent and a Scotland Yard detective team up to infiltrate an infamous counterfeit organisation. [S]

programme.title: The Great Rupert
programme.desc: 1950. Family Comedy. Directed by Irving Pichel. Stars Jimmy Durante, Terry Moore & Tom Drake. A little dancing squirrel with lots of charm helps two families overcome their obstacles. [S]

programme.title: This Week of Grace
programme.desc: 1933. Comedy. Directed by Maurice Elvey. Starring Gracie Fields, Henry Kendall & John Stuart. A poor, unemployed woman is made housekeeper at the estate of a wealthy duchess. [S]

programme.title: Hangman's Wharf
programme.desc: 1950. Thriller. Directed by Cecil H. Williamson. Stars John Witty, Genine Graham, Patience Rentoul & Gerald Nodin. A doctor is framed for murder. [S]

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: 1954. Action. Directed by John Ireland & Edward Sampson. Stars John Ireland & Dorothy Malone. A man framed for murder escapes prison and takes a young woman and her car on a wild race for freedom. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life You Can't Catch Much From a Fish! 1963
programme.desc: A look at the compulsory quarantine dogs and cats taken to Britain must go through in order to stop rabies being brought into the country.

programme.title: The Strange Woman
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Directed by Edgar G. Ulmer. Stars Hedy Lamarr, George Sanders & Louis Hayward. A beautiful, yet heartless woman, marries a rich man but also seduces his son and company foreman. [S]

programme.title: To Have and to Hold
programme.desc: 1951. Drama. Director: Godfrey Grayson. Stars Avis Scott, Patrick Barr & Robert Ayres. Following a riding accident, a countryman spends his final days arranging the future security of his family. [S]

programme.title: Snowbound
programme.desc: 1948. Mystery drama. Directed by David MacDonald and starring Dennis Price, Herbert Lom and Robert Newton. A group of people search for Nazi treasure hidden in the Alps. [S]

programme.title: Made for Each Other
programme.desc: 1939. Drama. Directed by John Cromwell. Stars Carole Lombard, James Stewart & Charles Coburn. After a whirlwind courtship, a young lawyer and his new wife's love is put to the test. [S]

programme.title: Walk a Crooked Mile
programme.desc: 1948. Crime. Director: Gordon Douglas. Stars Louis Hayward, Dennie O'Keefe & Carl Esmond. An FBI agent and a Scotland Yard sleuth join forces to track down a spy ring targeting an atomic plant. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Do It Yourself
programme.desc: 1961. An interesting look at the many and varied do-it-yourself jobs going on all over Britain.

programme.title: School For Secrets
programme.desc: 1946. War. Director Peter Ustinov. Stars Ralph Richardson and Richard Attenborough. During World War II, on the eve of the Battle of Britain, British scientists develop the first radar systems. [S]

programme.title: The 39 Steps (1959)
programme.desc: 1959. Thriller. Directed by Ralph Thomas. Stars Kenneth More, Taina Elg & Brenda de Banzie. A diplomat is inadvertently involved in the death of a spy, fleeing to Scotland to search for clues. [S]

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Alien Abduction. 1996. Michael Aspel delves into the bizarre stories and accounts of alien abductions and explores what are known as 'close encounters of the fourth kind'. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: A frightful night awaits all Cellar Dwellers, as Caroline Munro opens up the Cellar Club once more. First up, is another chilling episode of Doomwatch - Project Sahara. [S]

programme.title: Doomwatch
programme.desc: Project Sahara. 1970. Stars Robert Powell, Nigel Stock & Hildegard Neil. Doomwatch comes under suspicion. A mysterious department of security services uses a new computer to vet the scientists. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: The horror and thrills continue with the 1980 Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde. This classic story of good and evil stars David Hemmings, Lisa Harrow, Clive Swift, Ian Bannen, Diana Dors and Toyah Willcox. [S]

programme.title: Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde (1980)
programme.desc: 1980. Horror. Director: Alastair Reid. Stars David Hemmings, Lisa Harrow & Diana Dors. Dr Henry Jekyll experiments on his own personality, resulting in a terrifying struggle between good and evil. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Caroline Munro takes a little look at next week's fantastic features. [S]

programme.title: Play Dirty
programme.desc: 1969. War. Director: Andr De Toth. Stars Michael Caine, Nigel Davenport & Nigel Green. A fuel expert is ordered to guide a tough band of convicts across the desert to destroy an enemy fuel depot. [S]

programme.title: Play Dirty
programme.desc: 1969. War. Director: Andr De Toth. Stars Michael Caine, Nigel Davenport & Nigel Green. A fuel expert is ordered to guide a tough band of convicts across the desert to destroy an enemy fuel depot. [S]

programme.title: The Moderns
programme.desc: 1988. Drama. Director: Alan Rudolph. Stars Keith Carradine, Linda Fiorentino & Wallace Shawn. In 1920s Paris, a struggling artist's life takes an unexpected turn when he agrees to forge paintings. [S]

programme.title: Time To Remember
programme.desc: The End and the Beginning. 1964. Narrator: Sir Ralph Richardson. It's 1945. The enemy falls into the Allies hands. The leaders meet and it's V.E. Day. Russia joins the Allies in the war on Japan. [S]

programme.title: Race For The Yankee Zephyr
programme.desc: 1981. Action. Director: David Hemmings. Stars Ken Wahl, Lesley Ann Warren & Donald Pleasence. Local hunters compete with a gang of mercenaries to find a missing plane with a cargo of $50 million. [S]

programme.title: What's On TPTV With Noel
programme.desc: Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed throughout July. [S]

programme.title: Space Patrol
programme.desc: The New Planet. 1963. Stars Dick Vosburgh & Ronnie Stevens. A new planet beyond the orbit of Pluto is discovered, where a race of giants seize Captain Dart as a pet and use the ship as home decor. [S]

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Come Back, Shame. 1966. Stars Adam West, Burt Ward & Cliff Robertson. Batman and Robin reckon something's up when Shame steals Grimaldi Smith's hot racing car in the middle of the Gotham City 500. [S]

programme.title: Richard the Lionheart
programme.desc: The Conjurer. 1962. Stars Dermot Walsh, George Pastell & Riggs O'Hara. Ali, a Saracen youth with a flair for conjuring tricks, is ordered to infiltrate Richard's camp to assassinate the monarch. [S]

programme.title: Supercar
programme.desc: The Phantom Piper. 1961. Stars Graydon Gould, David Graham & George Murcell. The Supercar team heads to Scotland to investigate reports of a ghostly bagpiper. [S]

programme.title: The Cat Gang
programme.desc: 1958. Adventure. Directed by Darrel Catling. Stars Francesca Annis, John Pike, Jeremy Bulloch & John Gabriel. Three children and their adventures while on the track of a gang of smugglers. [S]

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
programme.desc: Trapped. 1960. Stars Richard Greene, Laurence Hardy, John Arnatt. Robin brings justice down on landowner Sir Hugo de Basque, who uses poor trespassers as slave labour if they can't pay his fines. [S]

programme.title: War of the Planets
programme.desc: 1977. Sci-fi. Directed by Alfonso Brescia. Stars John Richardson & Yanti Somer. Captain Alex Hamilton and his crew discover an enslaved planet while investigating a strange signal in space. [S]

programme.title: One Step Beyond
programme.desc: Echo. 1959. Stars John Newland, Ross Martin & Ed Kemmer. When Paul Martin is acquitted the murder of his wife, he moves to the country. However, he begins to have premonitions of his own murder. [S]

programme.title: Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons
programme.desc: Codename Europa. 1968. Stars Ed Bishop, Francis Matthews & Donald Gray. The Mysterons vow to assassinate the Triumvirate of Europe - the three most powerful men on Earth after the World President.

programme.title: The October Man
programme.desc: 1947. Crime. Director: Roy Ward Baker. Stars: John Mills, Edward Chapman, Joan Greenwood. A man is suspected of murder, and due to a previous brain injury, he begins to doubt his own innocence. [S]

programme.title: The Day Will Dawn
programme.desc: 1942. War. Director: Harold French. Stars Deborah Kerr, Ralph Richardson & Hugh Williams. A British foreign correspondent, forced out of Norway, returns to the occupied Scandinavian country. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Counting Heads
programme.desc: 1961. An account of the ten-yearly census - the first record in colour of the entire operation.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The Revolver. 1960. Stars Rupert Davies, Ewen Solon & Margaretta Scott. Maigret is faced with a strange situation when his revolver is stolen and seems likely to be used for attempted murder. [S]

programme.title: A Family At War
programme.desc: 1971. A Hero's Welcome. Stars Colin Douglas & Shelagh Fraser. Christmas 1941. Peter struggles with the image he has cultivated of his father, souring their relationship. (S2, E08) [S]

programme.title: Mickey One
programme.desc: 1965. Crime. Directed by Arthur Penn. Stars Warren Beatty, Alexandra Stewart & Hurd Hatfield. A stand-up comic incurs the wrath of the Mafia and escapes to Chicago but yearns to go back on stage. [S]

programme.title: She Played with Fire
programme.desc: 1958. Drama. Directed by Sidney Gilliat. Stars Jack Hawkins, Ian Hunter, Arlene Dahl & Dennis Price. An investigator finds himself involved in blackmail and murder after running into his ex. [S]

programme.title: Bullet Scars
programme.desc: 1942. Crime Drama. Directed by D. Ross Lederman. Stars Regis Toomey, Adele Longmire & Howard Da Silva. A doctor and a nurse are forced to treat a wounded gangster who was injured during a robbery. [S]
